title: Paid for IP Boost and didn't receive it.
body:
Hi summoners,
I paid for a 1 day (AKA 24 hour) Ip boost, and at the start, it looked like it worked as usual (the little icon highlighted at the top right), but after a short amount of gameplay, I realized that there was only "7 hours remaining" on the boost.
I looked on the forums, found one other person with the same issue, who was advised "submit a ticket to support".

So I did just that. I submitted a ticket to support, and got a response:
"We cant give you anything for free".
**followed by a buttload of promotional advertisements**
"After checking your account, I can see that your IP boost is intact and the number of hours have been accounted for".

The problem with the statement I received, is that they did not mention the two screenshots that were taken 1 hour after the other.
1 screenshot shows "7 hours remaining", then the next screenshot taken 1 hour later, shows "4 hours remaining".
The time and date were visible on my PC screen at the bottom right, and if you really wanted to check that the time was not tampered with, you could check the metadata for the image files themselves for the timestamp.
The URL's below link to the images.

I'll also note that the second image says "4 wins remaining + 4 hours remaining". Its completely wacked out... This was taken less than an hour after the first image which shows "0 wins remaining + 7 hours remaining".
I went to bed, woke up, and sure enough, the icon read "3 wins remaining + 0 hours remaining". 3 games later, it said I had run out of IP boost...
Its like it changed from a 24 hour boost, to a 4 win boost, or something wacked out like that... either way, i certainly did not get what I paid for...

If I was to ask the community's oppinion, would you say I deserve some kind of compensation at least, instead of the following response?:
"I cant give you anything for free, but I can spam you the promotions we are giving out to everyone this week"

i65.tinypic.com/6em4bq.jpg

i68.tinypic.com/35ib12b.jpg

P.s. considering, I paid real money for this Ip boost, providing some kind of compensation for this defective product/service I paid for, seems to me like something that should be required by law.
Right?

replies.body:
Hey there,

I'm currently in the process of getting another set of eyes to look into this, to double check that nothing was missed.

If you could provide a ticket number here for reference that would be great.

Hi, didnt realize someone finally replied to this.
The ticket is Request #22551842.

I've received another response after following it up, and they have said the following:

Summoner,

Thank you for providing me with this information. We have a Billing Support Team in place dedicated to working with issues like this one, so I need to transfer your ticket to someone with the tools to resolve your issue.

Please keep in mind that we respond to tickets in the order we receive them, so ‘bumping’ your ticket by sending us additional messages will send it to the back of our queue. This might inadvertently delay our response :(

Thank you in advance for your patience!

Energia
Riot Player Support
-----------------------------------------------
That was 3 days ago, and I haven't heard anything since.
Thanks for the reply.

Just leaving an update, that I was completely unsatisfied with the response from RIOT staff.
I was basically told, that if I have a problem with the way they handle refunds and compensation, I can go and complain to the department of fair trade in my country...

The images I showed, clearly demonstrated that I DID NOT get what I paid for, yet RIOT comes back at me and says "well sorry we don't care, go complain to someone else"...
Completely pathetic attitude RIOT.
